items.content_html:
I’ve been rewatching those stunt/dare/prank reality shows of my teenage years, like Jackass and Viva la Bam.

I just finished üçø “Jackass Forever”. They did introduce a few too many new people and it relied a bit too much on dick jokes, but overall it was better than I remembered. 62/100
items.content_text: I've been rewatching those stunt/dare/prank reality shows of my teenage years, like Jackass and Viva la Bam. I just finished üçø "[Jackass Forever](https://www.justwatch.com/uk/movie/jackass-forever)". They did introduce a few too many new people and it relied a bit too much on dick jokes, but overall it was better than I remembered. **62/100**

items.content_html: I began tagging emails as ‘not important,’ but soon realised I was labelling 95% of them that way. Turns out most of the email I get isn’t very important.
items.content_text: I began tagging emails as 'not important,' but soon realised I was labelling 95% of them that way. Turns out most of the email I get isn't very important.

items.content_html: Cleaning tip for people with ADHD. Make yourself a coffee and then start cleaning. You will move fast knowing that coffee is getting cold, and will get the task done in no time at all.
items.content_text: Cleaning tip for people with ADHD. Make yourself a coffee and _then_ start cleaning. You will move **fast** knowing that coffee is getting cold, and will get the task done in no time at all.

items.content_html: I completely misjudged how crowded the train would be and snagged the first available seat, right next to someone. Turns out the train is nearly empty and I now look like a maniac.
items.content_text: I completely misjudged how crowded the train would be and snagged the first available seat, right next to someone. Turns out the train is nearly empty and I now look like a maniac.

items.content_html:
I can eat lunch and lose focus and have an energy crash and struggle to get work done.

Or I can skip lunch and have an energy cash and struggle to get work done.

Either way I lose.

But sadly the no lunch approach often works best for me.
items.content_text:
I can eat lunch and lose focus and have an energy crash and struggle to get work done.

Or I can skip lunch and have an energy cash and struggle to get work done.

Either way I lose. 

But sadly the no lunch approach often works best for me.

items.content_html: I often accidentally type 2014 instead of 2024. And when I do 2014 as a date doesn‚Äôt feel that long ago. But then I realise that it is a literal decade ago.
items.content_text: I often accidentally type 2014 instead of 2024. And when I do 2014 as a date doesn‚Äôt _feel_ that long ago. But then I realise that it is a literal decade ago.

items.content_html: High-end hotels and first class plane tickets are two things I‚Äôm always shocked at the price of. Every time.
items.content_text: High-end hotels and first class plane tickets are two things I‚Äôm always shocked at the price of. Every time.

items.content_html: I‚Äôd never been in a proper bookshop nook before. The cosiest part of it is actually how it sounds in there. 360 degrees of books means all sound is absorbed like a lovely sponge.
items.content_text: I‚Äôd never been in a proper bookshop nook before. The cosiest part of it is actually how it sounds in there. 360 degrees of books means all sound is absorbed like a lovely sponge.

items.content_html: I‚Äôm actually really enjoying summer this year. But I have to admit, I still have autumn and Christmas on my mind rather often. I long for those crisp but foggy days when I crave nothing but walking, fantasy films and takeaways.
items.content_text: I‚Äôm actually really enjoying summer this year. But I have to admit, I still have autumn and Christmas on my mind rather often. I long for those crisp but foggy days when I crave nothing but walking, fantasy films and takeaways.

items.title: This is a test post
items.content_html:
This is a H2

I love discovering a wonderful new homepage or blog. Especially on the weekend when I have time to gently sip away at its content. This time it‚Äôs Arun and their website arun.is.

This is a H3

One of the biggest changes in my personality with middle age is that I no longer really enjoy travel beyond local weekend getaways. Almost no destination has a pain/novelty ratio that makes it worth it‚Ä¶ Even though travel has gotten way more convenient overall (smartphones, eSIM cards, cashless payments, Uber, Google Translate ‚Äî though at the expense of phone-loss anxiety), my tolerance for discomfort has plummeted. I don‚Äôt like shitty hotels/hostels, awkward couchsurfing, wrangling luggage, driving unfamiliar cars, figuring out transit systems‚Ä¶ I especially don‚Äôt like wading through lots of options figuring out food options. The net effect is that I‚Äôve gradually gone sessile.

Ordered list:

  1. First item
  2. Second item
  3. Third item
  4. Fourth item

Unordered list:

  • First item
  • Second item
  • Third item

this is some code. could be anything. SQL or JavaScript perhaps

Here’s a sentence with a footnote. 1

The world is flat.

I need to highlight these ==very important words==.

  1. This is the footnote. ↩︎

Almost no destination has a pain/novelty ratio that makes it worth it‚Ä¶ Even though travel has gotten way more convenient overall (smartphones, eSIM cards, cashless payments, Uber, Google Translate ‚Äî though at the expense of phone-loss anxiety), my tolerance for discomfort has plummeted. I don‚Äôt like shitty hotels/hostels, awkward couchsurfing, wrangling luggage, driving unfamiliar cars, figuring out transit systems‚Ä¶ I especially don‚Äôt like wading through lots of options figuring out food options. The net effect is that I‚Äôve gradually gone sessile. **Ordered list:** 1. First item 2. Second item 3. Third item 4. items.content_html: I love the illustration on the Pika.page. It makes me feel warm, fuzzy and happy for some reason. I really love it.

items.content_html: Got a big fat wave of nostalgia listening to this for the first time in a while. It came out just before a holiday to Portugal and was played endlessly for the duration of the trip. Playing it again I am immediately teleported back to sunny Lisbon, c. 2013.
items.content_text: Got a big fat wave of nostalgia listening to this for the first time in a while. It came out just before a holiday to Portugal and was played endlessly for the duration of the trip. Playing it again I am immediately teleported back to sunny Lisbon, c. 2013.
